msContents.summary: Register of abstracts of contracts. The entries are brief and, where the left side is preserved, there are entry numbers

msItemStruct.note: All fragments are written along the fibers; back blank on all fragments
Three fragments have a kollesis: 2a ca 2.5 cm. from left; 3b 1.6 cm. from right; 3d broken along kollesis
The papyrus is dark and very brittle
At least three different hands can be discerned. All are the competent cursives of the professional scribe
On most fragments the text is heavily abbreviated
The pattern of disintegration/wear indicates that, if not part of the same document, all pieces were originally stored together, probably in a pile

1a broken top and left; 1b broken top and right; 1c broken on all sides; 1d broken on all sides; 2a broken except for left; 2b broken except at bottom(?); 2c broken top and left + broken on all sides; 3a broken except at bottom(?); 3b broken except at bottom(?) 3c broken on all sides; 3d broken on all sides; 4a broken except for bottom(?); 4b broken on all sides; 4c broken on all sides; 5a broken on all sides; 5b broken on all sides
Conservation: many of the fragments are fragile and have pieces breaking off them. Not glassed

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman through H.I. Bell, in 1924; no. II.170 in Bell's inventory

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
